name: White Water Lily
description: A floating aquatic plant with round leaves and white flowers.
long_description: The White Water Lily is a beautiful aquatic plant found in freshwater ponds, lakes, and slow-moving rivers across Europe and parts of Asia. It is known for its large, round leaves that float on the water's surface and its striking white flowers, which open during the day and close at night.

name: Yellow Flag Iris
description: A tall wetland plant with bright yellow flowers.
long_description: The Yellow Flag Iris is a perennial wetland plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It thrives in marshes, ditches, and along riverbanks, where its striking yellow flowers stand out during the spring and summer.

name: Cattail
description: A common wetland plant with distinctive brown seed heads.
long_description: Cattails are essential wetland plants that provide habitat and food for wildlife. Their distinctive brown seed heads are visible throughout winter.

name: Marsh Marigold
description: A bright yellow flowering plant of wet areas.
long_description: Marsh Marigold is one of the first wetland plants to bloom in spring. Its bright yellow flowers light up wetland areas and stream banks.

name: Pickerelweed
description: An emergent aquatic plant with purple-blue flower spikes.
long_description: Pickerelweed grows in shallow water with heart-shaped leaves and spikes of small purple-blue flowers that bloom throughout summer.
